File Operations.Test Steps:
1. Launch application
2. Select option to create new document
File Operations.Expected Result: A new empty document is created successfully

File Operations.Test Steps:
1. Make changes to document
2. Attempt to close document
File Operations.Expected Result: Application prompts user to save changes before closing

File Operations.Test Steps:
1. Launch application
2. Select option to open document
3. Choose a valid file
File Operations.Expected Result: Document is opened successfully from the chosen file

File Operations.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select option to save document
3. Choose location and filename
File Operations.Expected Result: Document is saved successfully to the specified location

File Operations.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select option to create template
3. Choose location and filename
File Operations.Expected Result: Template is created successfully with structure and attributes preserved

File Operations.Test Steps:
1. Select option to create document from template
2. Choose a template file
File Operations.Expected Result: New document is created with structure and attributes from template

Import/Export.Test Steps:
1. Select import option
2. Choose a MS Word document
3. Complete import process
Import/Export.Expected Result: Document is imported with structure, formatting, and images preserved

Import/Export.Test Case Description: Import MS Excel table of requirements
Import/Export.Test Steps:
1. Select import option
2. Choose a MS Excel file
3. Complete import process
Import/Export.Expected Result: Requirements are imported with headings, levels, descriptions, and attribute values preserved

Import/Export.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select export to HTML option
3. Choose location and filename
Import/Export.Expected Result: Document is exported to HTML format correctly

Import/Export.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select export to CSV option
3. Choose location and filename
Import/Export.Expected Result: Requirements are exported to CSV format correctly

Document View.Test Steps:
1. Open a document with multiple sections
2. Observe table of contents
Document View.Expected Result: Table of contents displays section headings in hierarchical structure

Document View.Test Steps:
1. Open a document with multiple sections
2. Click on a section in table of contents
Document View.Expected Result: Application focuses on the selected section in requirements table

Document View.Test Case Description: Display requirements table with all columns
Document View.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Observe requirements table
Document View.Expected Result: Requirements table displays ID, Description, Discussion, Links and custom attribute columns

Document View.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Drag column divider to change width

1. Open a document
2. Drag column header to new position

1. Open a document
2. Use column visibility controls to hide a column
3. Use controls to show the column again
Document View.Expected Result: Columns can be hidden and shown as expected (except ID column)

Document View.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Click column header to sort
Document View.Expected Result: Table is sorted by the selected column (except Discussion and Links columns)

Detailed Information.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select a requirement
3. Toggle detailed information pane
Detailed Information.Expected Result: Detailed information pane can be shown and hidden

Detailed Information.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select a requirement with custom attributes
3. Show custom attributes pane
Detailed Information.Expected Result: All assigned custom attributes are displayed correctly

Detailed Information.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select a requirement with comments
3. Show discussion pane
Detailed Information.Expected Result: All comments are displayed in chronological order

Detailed Information.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select a requirement with comments
3. Show discussion pane
4. Expand and collapse comments
Detailed Information.Expected Result: Comments can be expanded and collapsed individually and collectively

Detailed Information.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select a requirement with links
3. Show links pane
Detailed Information.Expected Result: All traceability links are displayed grouped by link types

Detailed Information.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select a requirement with links
3. Show links pane
4. Click on a link
Detailed Information.Expected Result: Application focuses on the linked requirement

Document Structure Editing.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select a section
3. Create new requirement
Document Structure Editing.Expected Result: New requirement is created with unique ID

Document Structure Editing.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select requirements
3. Copy to another section

1. Open a document
2. Select requirements
3. Move to another section

1. Open a document
2. Select requirements
3. Mark as deleted

1. Open a document
2. Select deleted requirements
3. Undelete

1. Open a document
2. Select deleted requirements
3. Permanently remove
Document Structure Editing.Expected Result: Requirements are permanently removed from document

Requirement Editing.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select a section
3. Edit heading

1. Open a document
2. Select a requirement
3. Edit description

1. Copy HTML content from external application
2. Select a requirement
3. Paste into description
Requirement Editing.Expected Result: HTML content is pasted correctly with formatting preserved

Custom Attributes.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Access custom attributes management
3. Define new attribute with ID
Custom Attributes.Expected Result: New custom attribute is created with unique ID

Custom Attributes.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Access custom attributes management
3. Set attribute type

Custom Attributes.Test Case Description: Set multiple values for enum attribute
Custom Attributes.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select a requirement
3. Set multiple values for enum attribute
Custom Attributes.Expected Result: Multiple values are set correctly for enum attribute

Custom Attributes.Test Case Description: Change custom attribute type with automatic conversion
Custom Attributes.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Access custom attributes management
3. Change attribute type
Custom Attributes.Expected Result: Attribute type is changed and values are converted correctly

Custom Attributes.Test Case Description: Prevent attribute type change when conversion fails
Custom Attributes.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Access custom attributes management
3. Change attribute type to incompatible type
Custom Attributes.Expected Result: Application prevents type change when conversion would fail

Custom Attributes.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Access custom attributes management
3. Set attribute name

1. Open a document
2. Access custom attributes management
3. Remove attribute
Custom Attributes.Expected Result: Attribute is removed and values are unset in all requirements

Custom Attributes.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select a requirement
3. Edit custom attributes

Attachments.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select a requirement
3. Attach image file
Attachments.Expected Result: Image is attached to requirement with unique ID

Attachments.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select a requirement
3. Attach document file (PDF, Word, etc.)
Attachments.Expected Result: Document is attached to requirement with unique ID

Attachments.Test Case Description: Save attachment to local file system
Attachments.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select a requirement with attachment
3. Save attachment to file system
Attachments.Expected Result: Attachment is saved to local file system

Attachments.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select a requirement with attachment
3. Update attachment from file

1. Open a document
2. Select a requirement with attachment
3. Remove attachment
Attachments.Expected Result: Attachment is permanently removed from document

Comments.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select a requirement
3. Add comment
Comments.Expected Result: Comment is added with current date, time and author

Traceability Links.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Access link types management
3. Define new link type with ID
Traceability Links.Expected Result: New link type is created with unique ID

Traceability Links.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Access link types management
3. Set name and role names
Traceability Links.Expected Result: Link type properties are set correctly

Traceability Links.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Access link types management
3. Remove link type
Traceability Links.Expected Result: Link type is removed and all links of that type are removed

Traceability Links.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select source requirements
3. Create link to target requirements

1. Open a document
2. Select a traceability link
3. Change link type

1. Open a document
2. Select a traceability link
3. Revert direction

1. Open a document
2. Select a traceability link
3. Remove link

Auto Save.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Make changes
3. Close and restart application
Auto Save.Expected Result: Changes are persisted and restored after restart

Auto Save.Test Case Description: Clear persisted data on document close
Auto Save.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Make changes
3. Close document
4. Restart application
Auto Save.Expected Result: Persisted data is cleared when document is closed

Filtering.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Enter DNF filtering condition
3. Apply filter
Filtering.Expected Result: Requirements matching the condition are displayed

Filtering.Test Case Description: Filter by section number or heading
Filtering.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Enter filtering condition for section
3. Apply filter
Filtering.Expected Result: Sections matching the condition are displayed

Filtering.Test Case Description: Filter by text description or attribute
Filtering.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Enter filtering condition for text or attribute
3. Apply filter
Filtering.Expected Result: Requirements matching the condition are displayed

Filtering.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select filter for missing links of specific type
3. Apply filter
Filtering.Expected Result: Requirements with missing links are displayed

Search.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Enter search keywords
3. Execute search

1. Open a document
2. Execute search
3. Navigate to next/previous match
Search.Expected Result: Navigation between matched requirements works correctly

History.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Make changes to a requirement
3. View history
History.Expected Result: Changes are recorded with date, time and author

History.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select a requirement with history
3. View history pane
History.Expected Result: All changes are displayed in chronological order

History.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Select a requirement with history
3. View history pane
4. Expand/collapse entries
History.Expected Result: History entries can be expanded and collapsed

Reporting.Test Steps:
1. Open a document
2. Filter requirements if needed
3. Print requirements table

1. Open a document
2. Filter requirements if needed
3. Create PDF
Reporting.Expected Result: PDF is created with requirements table

Performance.Test Steps:
1. Start application
2. Open a document
3. Measure time until document is displayed

1. Open a document
2. Make edits to requirements
3. Measure response time

1. Open a document with many requirements
2. Scroll through requirements table
3. Observe scrolling behavior

1. Create/open a document with 10,000 objects and 100 attachments (100MB total)
2. Perform various operations

Security.Test Steps:
1. Create and save a document
2. Examine persistent data

1. Monitor network traffic
2. Perform various operations in application
Security.Expected Result: No project data is sent to the Internet

Security.Test Steps:
1. Input potentially malicious data
2. Import potentially malicious files

Browser Compatibility.Test Steps:
1. Launch application in latest Chrome version
2. Perform basic operations

1. Launch application in latest Firefox version
2. Perform basic operations
